label: KasaPowerStripCLI
peekOfCode:
class KasaPowerStripCLI:
    """CLI interface for controlling TP-Link HS300 Smart Power Strip."""
    def __init__(self, ip_address: str = "192.168.50.137"):
        """
        Initialize the CLI with the power strip IP address.
        Args:
            ip_address: IP address of the power strip
        """
        self.ip_address = ip_address
        self.power_strip = None

label: main
peekOfCode:
def main():
    """Main entry point for the CLI application."""
    import argparse
    parser = argparse.ArgumentParser(
        description="CLI for controlling TP-Link HS300 Smart Power Strip"
    )
    parser.add_argument(
        "--ip",
        default="192.168.50.137",
        help="IP address of the power strip (default: 192.168.2.3)"

label: demo_basic_usage
peekOfCode:
def demo_basic_usage():
    """Demonstrate basic usage of the CLI."""
    print("=== TP-Link HS300 Power Strip CLI Demo ===\n")
    # Create CLI instance
    cli = KasaPowerStripCLI("192.168.2.3")
    # Try to connect
    if not cli.connect():
        print("Failed to connect to power strip. Please check:")
        print("1. Power strip is powered on")
        print("2. IP address is correct")

def test_installation():
    """Test the installation by importing the modules."""
    print("\nðŸ§ª Testing installation...")
    try:
        # Test importing the CLI module
        sys.path.insert(0, os.path.dirname(os.path.abspath(__file__)))
        from src.kasa_cli import KasaPowerStripCLI
        print("âœ… CLI module imported successfully")
        # Test importing the original library
        from KasaSmartPowerStrip import SmartPowerStrip

def show_usage_instructions():
    """Show usage instructions."""
    print("\nðŸŽ‰ Installation completed successfully!")
    print("\nðŸ“– Usage Instructions:")
    print("=" * 50)
    print("1. Configure your power strip IP address:")
    print("   - Edit config.py and change POWER_STRIP_IP")
    print("   - Or use command line: --ip 192.168.2.3")
    print("\n2. Run the CLI:")
    print("   python src/kasa_cli.py --ip 192.168.2.3")

peekOfCode:
def run_tests_with_unittest():
    """Run tests using unittest directly."""
    try:
        print("ðŸš€ Running tests with unittest...")
        # Add the current directory to the path
        sys.path.insert(0, str(Path(__file__).parent))
        # Run tests with unittest
        cmd = [sys.executable, "-m", "unittest", "discover", "-s", "tests", "-v"]
        result = subprocess.run(cmd, cwd=Path(__file__).parent)
        return result.returncode == 0

label: main
peekOfCode:
def main():
    """Main function to run tests."""
    print("ðŸ§ª Kasa HS300 CLI Test Runner")
    print("=" * 40)
    # Try different test runners in order of preference
    runners = [
        ("uv", run_tests_with_uv),
        ("pytest", run_tests_with_pytest),
        ("unittest", run_tests_with_unittest),
    ]
